question_sentence: What is the name of the 1,500-square-mile iceberg that is on the move after breaking away from Antarctica?
evidence: The iceberg, which is the largest in the world, had been stuck on the ocean floor of the Weddell Sea since breaking loose from the Antarctic shelf in 1986, but is now heading towards the Southern Ocean. Scientists say the trillion-ton berg is drifting at a rate of three miles a day, but why it is on the move is unclear.

question_sentence: The Americans for Prosperity Action group is backing which Republican presidential candidate?
evidence: Founded by the billionaire Koch brothers, the Americans for Prosperity Action group this week announced its support for Haley, calling her a "candidate who can turn the page and win". Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: All 41 workers trapped in a collapsed tunnel in the northern Himalayas were rescued after how many days stuck underground?
evidence: The workers became trapped when part of the under-construction Silkyara tunnel, in the Indian state of Uttarkashi, collapsed on 12 November following a landslide. They were finally freed on Tuesday, following a large-scale rescue operation.

question_sentence: What is Merriam-Webster's word of the year for 2023?
evidence: Announcing the decision on Monday, the dictionary’s editor at large, Peter Sokolowski, said the rise of AI had "helped drive interest in the word", as "the line between 'real' and 'fake' has become increasingly blurred". Other words on the shortlist included "dystopian" and "deepfake".

question_sentence: Red Bull driver Max Verstappen ended this year's F1 season with a record 19th Grand Prix victory where?
evidence: The Belgian-Dutch driver's win at the season finale on Sunday gave him an 86.4% win rate in this year's 22 F1 races. Verstappen has broken his own record of 15 wins last year, which smashed the previous record of 13 by Sebastian Vettel and Michael Schumacher.

question_sentence: What is the name of Omid Scobie's controversial new book about the British royal family?
evidence: Journalist Scobie also co-authored 2020 bestseller "Finding Freedom" about Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. His latest book makes a number of "highly controversial allegations" about the Windsors, said The Daily Telegraph, and promises "details on unsolved mysteries".

question_sentence: The vice president of which Middle Eastern country is funding a bid to take control of the UK's Telegraph newspaper group?
evidence: Sheikh Mansour's investment fund, IMI, is making a joint bid with US firm RedBird to take over the Telegraph Media Group, which owns The Daily Telegraph and The Spectator magazine. Critics have argued that the deal would be a threat to the papers' editorial independence, given the restrictions on press freedom in the autocratic UAE.

question_sentence: What did Dutch people put on their heads this week to celebrate a national day?
evidence: Every 29 November, residents of the Netherlands celebrate Sint Pannekoek (Saint Pancake) by placing the eponymous pudding on their heads, in a tradition started by a 1980s cartoon. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which author won the 2023 Booker Prize?
evidence: Announced at a ceremony in London on Sunday, this year's Booker Prize winner is among four Irish writers who made the 13-strong longlist. Commentators claimed that Lynch's victory confirms we are in what Sebastian Barry, the laureate for Irish fiction, has called a "golden age of Irish prose writing".

question_sentence: Elon Musk told advertisers fleeing his social media platform X (formerly Twitter) to do what?
evidence: X and Tesla owner Musk overshadowed this week's release of his much-hyped Cybertruck by lashing out at major advertisers who have fled his social media platform over antisemitic content. During an interview at The New York Times DealBook conference on Wednesday, the billionaire claimed the boycott was going to "kill the company".

question_sentence: One of America’s most well-known Christmas trees toppled over in gusty winds this week. Where did this occur?
evidence: The 40-foot National Christmas tree in Washington, DC, was knocked down by high winds on Tuesday. It was later righted.

question_sentence: Which day this week was dedicated to volunteering, donating, and doing good for others?
evidence: A few days after Black Friday, millions of people celebrated Giving Tuesday (the Tuesday after Thanksgiving) by volunteering, doing good and donating to causes around the world.

question_sentence: Which tech leader met with Israel’s president this week?
evidence: Elon Musk visited Israel Monday, meeting the country’s leaders as he tried to calm the outrage caused by his endorsement of an antisemitic post on his social media platform, X.

question_sentence: Tribute events were held for former first lady Rosalynn Carter this week in which state?
evidence: Three days of planned tributes took place across Georgia for Rosalynn Carter, the state where she grew up alongside her husband, former President Jimmy Carter. She died on November 19 at the age of 96.

question_sentence: Which company said it will begin deleting accounts that have been inactive for at least two years?
evidence: Google this week is beginning to delete inactive accounts to prevent security risks.

question_sentence: Which type of recalled food was mistakenly distributed to several large retailers?
evidence: Several large retailers in the US — including Publix, Walmart and Aldi — received recalled fruit, the FDA warned Tuesday. The batches of non-organic peaches, plums and nectarines have been linked with a Listeria outbreak that caused at least one death.

question_sentence: Which country said it will ban smoking on beaches and in public parks?
evidence: France will ban smoking on beaches and in public parks as the country’s government aims to create a “tobacco-free generation by 2032,” the country’s health minister said this week.

question_sentence: Which type of structure recently collapsed in India, trapping dozens of workers?
evidence: Forty-one workers were rescued from a collapsed tunnel in India after a 17-day ordeal.

question_sentence: Where is the global COP28 climate summit being held?
evidence: Tens of thousands of people are heading to Dubai for COP28, the annual international climate summit convened by the United Nations.

question_sentence: Which state is revising its planned 2024 license plate design following hundreds of complaints?
evidence: One major criticism of the proposed 2024 Kansas license plate design is the color scheme, with many saying it resembled those of other states and the University of Missouri — a rival of the University of Kansas.

question_sentence: Which route has been completely canceled by Avelo Airlines?
What motivated the University of Delaware to join Conference USA?
choices: To enhance awareness of academic offerings and research initiatives
To establish a new indoor practice facility

question_sentence: What significant change has occurred in the sale of Delaware surf-fishing permits for 2024?
choices: Reservations are no longer required for driving on the beach on summer weekends and holidays.
There is now a limit on the number of surf-fishing permits that can be sold.
A reservations system for "peak days" has been introduced.

question_sentence: What holiday-themed Pop-Tart flavor did Pop-Tarts playfully suggest on their Instagram, eliciting mixed reactions?
What tragic event occurred to the Philadelphia boxer known as Tsunami Sam shortly after Thanksgiving?
choices: He announced his retirement from boxing
He was fatally shot in Wilmington

question_sentence: What is the main concern raised in the news article regarding Delaware elections officials and their oversight of campaign finance laws?
choices: The excessive use of advisory opinions by the election commissioner
The lack of penalties for campaigns filing late reports
The need for additional funding for the Department of Elections

question_sentence: What is the theme for the White House holiday décor as unveiled by first lady Jill Biden?
choices: The Magic, Wonder, and Joy of Childhood

question_sentence: What significant changes are expected with the new Duck Creek Regional Library in Smyrna?
choices: The library will be nine times larger than the current Smyrna Library and will no longer be operated by the town.
The library will be smaller than the current Smyrna Library.
The library will be operated by the town of Smyrna with funds from the county.

question_sentence: What is the main concern expressed by residents of West Center City in Wilmington regarding the Neighborhood Stabilization Program led by Mayor Mike Purzycki?
choices: Insufficient police presence and community engagement
Fear of gentrification and being priced out of the area
Limited access to information and communication from city leaders

question_sentence: What is the main focus of Bryan Stevenson's work as the founder and executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative?
choices: Criminal Justice Reform and Human Rights
